Group.Title: 001 - Menus
Group.Des: These are the commands that appear in OurWord's menus. The ampersands (&) indicate the hotkey that is underlined in the menu. You should take care that within a single menu (e.g., the Edit menu), that all ampersands indicate a different letter (that is, that there are no letters used more than once within a given menu.)

Item.Info: Main menu item for the Project submenu, contains the submenu items of Open Project, New Project, Save Project, etc.
Menu command to create a new project.
Menu command to open an existing project.
Menu command to save the Project, all of the settings, and the currently open book.
Main menu item for the Edit submenu, contains the submenu items of Cut, Copy, Paste, etc.
Main menu item for the Notes submenu, contains the submenu items of Insert Note, Delete Note, etc.
Main menu item for the GoTo submenu, contains the submenu items of First, Previous, etc.
Main menu item for the Window submenu, contains the submenu items of Drafting, BT, etc.
Main menu item for the Tools submenu, contains the submenu items of Options, Setup Features, etc.
Main menu item for the Help submenu, contains the submenu items of Topics, About, etc.

Group.Title: 002 - Toolbar Text
Group.Des: These are the buttons that appear in the 'Just the Basics' toolbar. Since these must fit on a button, you need to be as concise as possible. Where a multi-word phrase is fine for a menu, it will be too long on a toolbar button.

Item.Tip: Exit Our Word
Save the current edits to disk file
Cut
Copy
Paste
Italic
Go to the First Section in the book
Go to the Previous Section (or use the down-arrow to bring up a list of previous sections)
Go to the Next Section (or use the down-arrow to bring up a list of following sections)
Go to the Last Section in the book
Go to a different book
Change to the Drafting Job
Change to the Naturalness Check Job
Change to the Back Translation Job
Notes
Insert a general note
Insert a general note
Insert a To Do note
Insert an Ask The UNS note
Insert an Ask The UNS note
Insert a Definition note
Insert an Old Version note
Insert a Reason note
Insert a Front Issue note
Insert a Hint For Daughter note
Insert a note about the Back Translation
Delete this note.
Tools
Help

Item.Info: A boolean answer to a Yes/No question, e.g., in the Paragraph Settings, there is the property: 'Keep with Next Paragraph', and the answer is 'Yes' or 'No'
A boolean answer to a Yes/No question, e.g., in the Paragraph Settings, there is the property: 'Keep with Next Paragraph', and the answer is 'Yes' or 'No'

Item.English: The Target Translation is the vernacular translation that you are producing. You use the Front Translation as a source to create the Target. If you are a mother-tongue translator, then the Target Translation is a translation into your own language.
Start from scratch to initialize settings for your target translation. You will be presented with blank settings, and will need to enter the name of the translation, its books, etc.
Make use of existing settings for your target translation. If you defined the translation in another project, then you can reuse it here, rather than entering the information all over again.

Item.Info: Status bar message when a filter is being calculated.
Status bar message when a filter is active.
Status bar message while formatting pages to prepare for printing.
Status bar message while printing.
A temporary reference that is displayed when a new note is inserted; until such time that the Scripture Reference can instead be used. Note that this is all in upper case.
The flashing cursor to show where text will be entered should the user begin typing.

Group.Title: Strings: General UI
Group.Des: These are elements that appear in the main window of the user interface, such as the names of windows.

Item.Info: The title of the Drafting window pane, so that the user knows which task he is doing.

The Scripture Reference that appears in the Drafting window pane titlebar. Usually it will appear along the lines of 'Spanish to English' In the string, {0} refers to the name of the source translation (e.g., 'Spanish') and {1} refers to the vernacular translation (e.g., 'English'.) Thus you must make certain that your translation has both the {0} and the {1}.
The title of the Back Translation window pane, so that the user knows which task he is doing.

The Scripture Reference that appears in the Back Translation window pane titlebar. It will appear along the lines of 'Spanish' In the string, {0} refers to the name of the target translation (e.g., 'Spanish').
The title of the Naturalness Check window pane, so that the user knows which task he is doing.

The Scripture Reference that appears in the Naturalness Check window pane titlebar. Usually it will appear along the lines of 'Spanish - John 3:16' In the string, {0} refers to the name of the translation (e.g., 'Spanish') and {1} refers to the reference ('John 3:16'). Thus you must make certain that your translation has both the {0} and the {1} (see the English as an example.). The purpose of this is to give you freedom over the word order, and you may use something other than the hyphen to separate them.
A message we display (in the Task Bar) when the settings have not yet defined a Project.
A message we display when the source translation is not adequately defined in the settings.
A message we display when the target translation is not adequately defined in the settings.
The title of the Notes tab in the side-window.
The title of the Translations tab in the side-window.

Item.English: (There is no data to display. Use the Project-Properties menu item to set up both a Front and a Target translation.)
Item.Info: A message we display when not enough settings have been supplied that we can display anything in the editing window.

Item.English: Select the folder where you wish to place your backup files. If possible, this should not be your hard drive. A flash card is ideal; or a floppy drive can also be used.
Item.Info: Instructions that are placed in the Browse For Backup Folder Dialog.

Group.Title: Note Definitions
Group.Des: These are the names of the various notes supported in OurWord

Group.Title: Notes Support
Group.Des: Currently, these are the text that are inserted for different types of Notes.

Item.Info: The text that is inserted at the beginning of a To Do note.
The text that is inserted at the beginning of a Front Issue note.
The text that is inserted at the beginning of a Back Translation note.
The text that is inserted at the beginning of a Ask UNS note.
The text that is inserted at the beginning of a Hint For Daughter note.
The text that is inserted at the beginning of a Greek exegetical note.
The text that is inserted at the beginning of a Hebrew Exegetical note.
The text that is inserted at the beginning of a Exegeteis note.

Group.Title: File Filters and File Operations
Group.Des: These are elements that have to do with opening, browsing, and saving files.

Item.Info: This text is used in the Windows Save As dialog, to choose the type of file to save. OurWord always saves Project with the OWP extension. It is very important that you only change the English words, leave the rest of the text alone.

This text is used in the Windows Save As dialog, to choose the type of file to save. OurWord always saves Translation with the OTRANS extension. It is very important that you only change the English words, leave the rest of the text alone.

This text is used in the Windows Save As dialog, to choose the type of file to save. OurWord always saves Team Settings with the OWT extension. It is very important that you only change the English words, leave the rest of the text alone.
On creating a new project, OurWord will propose this file name (which the user can then change.)
On creating a new translation settings file, OurWord will propose this file name (which the user can then change.)
This text will appear in the Title of the Save As dialog, when a new translation settings filename is being supplied.
This text will appear in the Title of the Open dialog, when an existing translation settings filename is being browsed to.
This text will appear in the Title of the Save As dialog, when the user is supplying a filename for the export operation.

This text is used in the Windows Save As dialog, to choose the type of file to export to. The English indicates which file format(s) are currently supported by OurWord. It is very important that you only change the English words, leave the rest of the text alone.
The Browse Button on the RestoreFromBackup dialog launches a standard Windows-supplied dialog to locate the backup file. The only item we can customize on this form is that dialog’s title.

Group.Title: Stylenames
Group.Des: Here you can provide equivalents for various Styles found in the Stylesheet.

Item.Info: The title of a section, corresponds to a \s in USFM.
An optional subtitle of a section, corresponds to a \s2 in USFM.
An optional cross reference of a section, corresponds to a \r in USFM.
The main title of the book, corresponds to a \mt in USFM.
An optional sub title of the book, corresponds to a \st in USFM.
The running header of the book, corresponds to \h in USFM.
A picture caption

Group.Title: Dialog: Common
Group.Des: These are common text that appear on numerous dialogs, such as the OK or Cancel buttons.

Item.Info: cThe name of the Our Word software, which will appear in large font in the splash screen.

Group.Title: 004 - Messages
Group.Des: These are various error messages that OurWord displays. The vast majority occur during setup. If you see anything enclosed by braces (e.g., {n}, {0}, etc., take care to reproduce these exactly in the error message. The {n} represents a new line, so that the error message does not spread across the entire with of the screen. The numbers ({0}, {1}, etc.,) are substitutions. Thus "You do not have permission to write the file {0}" will become, at runtime, "You do not have permission to write the file MyFile.db."

Item.English: Please discuss suggested changes or improvements with your team advisor. Further changes to {0} cannot be made directly on this computer.
Please enter a valid Folder for storing this book's data.
Please enter the filename that you wish to import.
Please enter a name for the book, e.g., 'Matthew.'
Notes cannot be inserted for book titles, picture captions or footnotes.

Changing the language has the following effects:{n}1. The stage names will be reset to their 'factory' defaults,{n}2. File names of books will change (over time, as they are saved.){n}{n}Are you sure you wish to change to {0}?
The file: {n} {0}{n}already exists on the disk. Are you sure you want to overwrite it?
Item.Info: This error will appear during the Import process, should the user give, as a save file name, a file that already exists on the disk.

Item.English: This will replace {0} as your front translation.{n}{n}Are you sure you want to do this?
Are you sure you want to delete the note:{n} {0}?
This will replace {0} as your target translation.{n}{n}Are you sure you want to do this?

You are about to delete a Translation Stage. If you have any books{n}in your translation that are at this Stage, they will no longer have{n}the correct stage information.{n}{n}Are you sure you want to delete '{0}'?
Are you sure you want to reset the entire stylesheet back to the default values?
Are you sure you want to reset the Translation Stages back to the default values?
The name of the book cannot be identical to the name of another book in this translation.
Translation Stages cannot have duplicate names.
There was not enough space on drive {0} for the backup.
Item.Info: Unfortunately, the user will have to clear off files to get around this error message.

Item.English: Please enter the chapter numbers that you wish to print.
Please enter the page numbers that you wish to print.

Unable to write backup file: {n}{n} {0}{n}{n}Please make sure there is something in the drive (e.g., a floppy disk, or flash memory; or whatever is appropriate{n}for the type of drive.{n}{n}Press Yes to try again, or No to cancel the backup.
Item.Info: On making a backup, this message anticipates that the backup device is missing, and prompts the user to try again. Take care that {n} and {0} are exactly repeated, as they account for line breaks and filename substitutions (see the above description for Messages.)

Item.English: There were no sections that matched your criteria.
You do not have system permission to write the file: {n}{n} {0}.
Item.Info: This error occurs when Windows prevents writing the file, which can be for a variety of reasons (e.g., the file is open in another program.)

Item.English: You have not defined a Front Translation for this project. Do you want to now?
You have not defined a Target Translation for this project. Do you want to now?
Please enter an abbreviation for the translation, e.g., 'Ama'.{n}{n}This will be used to create the file name. The 3-letter Ethnologue code{n}is normally used for this abbreviation.
Please enter a valid File Name for storing the settings for this translation.
Please enter a name for the translation, e.g., 'Spanish.'
Do you want to remove this book from the translation? (This will not delete the file from the disk; it only removes OurWord's awareness that the book exists.)
Do you want to remove this translation from the project? (This will not delete the file from the disk.)
Are you sure you want to replace file: {n} {0}{n}with backup file: {n} {1}?
Item.Info: This message is displayed during the Restore From Backup command, to make certain that the user wants to overwrite his current work with the backup.

Item.English: A verse field was encountered but there was no paragraph marker for the verse to go into.
Item.Info: Error message that can occur on reading/importing a book.

Item.English: A \\v was encountered but there was no verse number beside it.
Item.Info: Error message that can occur on reading/importing a book.

Item.English: A translator note was encountered but there was no paragraph marker for it to go into.
Item.Info: Error message that can occur on reading/importing a book.

Item.English: A \\c was encountered but there was no paragraph marker before it.
Item.Info: Error message that can occur on reading/importing a book.

Item.English: Unable to open the file due to a bad Chapter Number field.
Item.Info: Error message that can occur on reading/importing a book.

Item.English: A cross-reference field (\\cf) was encountered but there was no paragraph marker for the reference to go into.
Item.Info: Error message that can occur on reading/importing a book.

Item.English: A section (\\s) was encountered that did not have a verse (\\v) field in it.
Item.Info: Error message that can occur on reading/importing a book.
Error message that is displayed should the user attempt to launch multiple copies of OurWord.

Item.English: Warning: The file '{0}' already exists in this folder. OurWord will overwrite it. If you wish to preserve this file, you should either choose a different folder, or you should move it to another folder.
Item.Info: This warning appears in the Import File wizard. OurWord generates its own file names; thus this warning is to show the user that if they store the file in the chosen folder, the existing file will be overwritten.

Item.English: There is a structure mistmatch in section {0}:{n} {1} has {2},{n} {3} has {4}.{n}{n}
The verses first get off at Section {0}.
{0} has extra sections appended at the end.
The two books appear to not have the same number of sections.{n} {0} has {1}; {2} appears to have {3}.{n}{4}

Group.Title: 007 - Book Abbreviations
Group.Des: Many languages may prefer to skip this section, and just use the English abbreviations; as these are a common publishing standard. Alternatively, if you wish the file names to be more readable in the local language, then you may wish to provide more meaningful language equivalents for them.

Group.Title: 008 - Book Groupings
Group.Des: When a larger number of books has been entered into a Project, OurWord will collapse the books in the GoTo-Book menu into a tree structure, so that the user is not faced with a scrolling menu of 66 books. You need to provide the names for these groupings.

Group.Title: 009 - Translation Stages
Group.Des: These are the stages that a typical book paases through as it goes from Draft to final publication. For each one, there is both a full name (e.g., "Team Check") and an abbreviation (e.g., "Team".) The full name appears in the user interface; the abbreviation is used to generate file names.

Item.Info: Abbreivation for the Drafting stage.
Abbreivation for the Team Check stage.
Abbreivation for the Advisor Check stage.
Abbreivation for the Community Check stage.
Abbreivation for the Back Translation stage.
Abbreivation for the Consultant Check stage.
Abbreivation for the Final for Printing stage.
Abbreivation for the Final Revisions stage.
Full name for the Drafting stage.
Full name for the Team Check stage.
Full name for the Advisor Check stage.
Full name for the Community Check stage.
Full name for the Back Translation stage.
Full name for the Consultant Check stage.
Full name for the Final For Printing stage.
Full name for the Final Revisions stage.

Group.Title: 101 - Dialog: Restore From Backup
Group.Des: Guides the user through the task of restoring a file that was previously backed up under the AutoBackup feature. The user is prompted to supply the name of the file to be backed up, and is given a final 'Are You Sure?' chance to cancel. Invoked via 'Tools-Restore From Backup'

Item.Info: Serves both as the (1) Dialog Title and (2) as the Tools menu command that invokes the dialog.

Item.English: This will restore a previous version of the book, replacing the current version. It will overwrite the current version, you will no longer have it on your computer.
Item.Info: Serves as an explanation of what this command will do. We want to make certain that the user realizes that he will be replacing if more recent work with older work.
Shows the name of the book, which is composed of the Language Name and the Book Name.

Item.English: Previously Backed-Up File to be Restored:
Item.Info: An extra prompt to make certain the user understands this is the file that will replace his current one.
The filename that will be restored.

Group.Title: 102 - Dialog: SetupFeatures
Group.Des: Supports the ability to turn features on/off in the user interface. in order to customize the experience for the manner in which an individual will use the software.

Item.English: Place a check beside the features you want to turn on in the user interface.
A layout where you can do a Back Translation; that is, where you provide a translation in the language the consultant understands.
A layout where only the translation visible, so that you can read through for naturalness, without being influenced by the front translation.
Turn this on if you are working with multiple projects.
Turn this on if you are want to adjust the properties for a project.
The book can be formatted and printed.

Setups AutoReplace, whereby when characters are typed, they are replaced with an alternative string. Use this for keyboarding special characters, or for shorthand (e.g., type AB and have it expand to 'Abraham.')

Files can be automatically backed up (via the Tools-Options command) to a flash card or other storage device. If you turn on this Restore feature, the Tools menu will provide access to a dialog by which the current file can be replaced by a previously stored backup.
Copy the BT from the Front Translation

Copies the back translation from the Front to the Target. This provides a convenient starting place for a back translation which you should then plan on carefully reviewing and editing, so that it accurately matches the actual vernacular translation.

The 'Go To' Menu (e.g., Next, Previous commands) will only go to those sections which match certain criteria. E.g., they must have a certain word defined, or must have mismatched quotes. This can be a good way to locate errors, or To Do Notes.

Designed for newer computer users, this feature sets up the user interface to support a very basic level of work, turning off many of the features. The menu is hidden, and in its place the toolbar buttons show descriptive text in addition to their pictures. Users only need to be familiar with about a dozen commands.
This dialog, appearing in the Tools menu, allows you to translate the user interface of OurWord into another language.
(Take care to remember this password. E.g., Upper vs. lower case is significant.)
Please enter your password to access the 'Setup Features' dialog.
Enter the names of books in your language. These will be used to automatically generate cross references and parallel passage references.

Item.Info: The title of the dialog.
The Print button

Item.English: Navigate to the file where the settings are stored. The file name usually contains the name of the language, e.g.,
Navigate to the folder where you want to store the settings file. The file name usually contains the name of the language, e.g., 'Spanish.otrans.'
A short abbreviation of rhe language name. The Ethnologue offers suitable 3-letter abbreviations for most of the world's languages.
Enter the name of the language, e.g., 'Spanish', 'Lakota Sioux.'

Group.Title: 109 - Dialog: Resolve Conflict on Copy BT From Front

Item.English: Copying the Back Translation from the Front Translation
Do this for any remaining conflicts.
Add the Front to the Target
Replace the Target with the Front
A Back Translation already exists for this paragraph
Copyright © 2004-08 John Wimbish. All rights reserved.
A program which assists Mother-Tongue Bible Translators and their supporting team, who are making use of a quality Front Translation.
Error on attempt to read book
You can fix the error and click on the Try Again button below, or you can Cancel the import.
An error occurred in attempting to import the book "{0}":
If you do not fix the error, {0} will be removed from the {1} properties.{n}{n} Are you sure you want to cancel reading the book?

Group.Title: 112 - DialogFilter
Group.Des: The "Only Show Sections That" is the filter dialog, used to restrict the Go To menu to a subset of sections that match the filter criteria.

Item.Info: The title of the dialog, this should be the same as the menu command.

Item.English: Only show those sections that have....
Item.Info: The header inside the dialog
Group title for those filters which compare a text string. Following are the check boxes in this section:
Group title for those filters which look for sections that have a gven type of note. Check boxes are To Do, and Ask UNS
Group title for those filters which look for problem areas. Checkboxes are Untranslated Text, Mismatched Quotes, Punctuation Problem, and Picture Cannot be Located on Disk.
Group title for those filters which look at styles, paragraph structure, etc. Check boxes are (1) A Picture with a Caption, and (2) A Quote Paragraph.

The label beside the combo box, by which the user chooses options for either being satisfied if just one filter matches, or requiring all checked options to match. Options for the combo are: "Any One of These are True" and "All of These are True."

Item.English: Any One of These are True

Group.Title: Properties Dialog: StyleSheet Page
Group.Des: This is the Writing Systems properties page within the Properties dialog. Many of the controls start with 'prop', e.g., 'propFontName'. These are small labels that appear beside the setting to be changed. There is always a corresponding ToolTip in these cases, by which you should provide some additional helpful information to the user.

Item.Info: Text on the button which resets the stylesheet back to the factory defaults.

Item.English: Select a style from the list on the left, then edit its settings below. Some settings require you to click on the plus sign in order to edit their settings.

Item.Tip: The color of the font text.
Specify Centered, Left, Right, or Justified paragraph alignment.
If Yes, there will not be a page break between paragraphs.
The Left Margin for the paragraph.
The Right Margin for the paragraph.
The First Line Indentation for the paragraph.
The points to add before the paragraph.
The points to add following the paragraph.

Item.Info: This is the label that shows up in the settings of the StyleSheet page, indicating to the user that the setting to the right is the name of the font. These labels should all be relatively short.
Item.Tip: The name of the font for displaying the style in this writing system
The height of the font.
If Yes, the font is displayed in boldface.
If Yes, the font is displayed in italics.
These are the font settings to use for this writing system.

Group.Title: Properties Dialog: Writing Systems page
Group.Des: This is the Writing Systems properties page within the Properties dialog. Many of the controls start with 'prop', e.g., 'propFontName'. These are small labels that appear beside the setting to be changed. There is often a corresponding ToolTip, by which you should provide some additional helpful information to the user.

Item.English: Select a writing system from the list, then edit its settings below.

Item.Tip: Provide a unique name for this Writing System.
A list of those letters that are punctuation in this writing system.
A list of punctuation that can occur at the end of a sentence.

Group.Title: Properties Dialog: Advanced Print Options Page

Item.English: At the bottom of ODD Pages

Item.Tip: What do you want to print at the bottom left of odd-numbered pages?
What do you want to print at the bottom center of odd-numbered pages?
What do you want to print at the bottom right of odd-numbered pages?

Item.English: At the bottom of EVEN Pages

Item.Tip: What do you want to print at the bottom left of even-numbered pages?
What do you want to print at the bottom center of even-numbered pages?
What do you want to print at the bottom right of even-numbered pages?
Team-wide Copyright Notice (you can define a copyright for eachindividual book by using the Book Properties dialog.)

Item.English: Provide the filename under which you wish to store this project's team settings.
Open an already-existing team settings file (that is, use existing team settings that have already been created.)

Team Settings are stored in a separate file, so that if you have multiple projects within a single cluster, all of the projects can use the same Team Settings. Thus you can edit them here, and they will apply to all other projects that use them.

Item.Info: This is the label to the left of the box showing the current pathname.
This is the name of the groupbox (the box drawn arounod all of these controls.)

Item.English: Click twice, slowly, over a name in order to edit it.
These Stage Names are used in the User Interface and in generating file names; you should enter them in the language that is the most useful for the translator.
A Reference Translation is another translation that you may want to view during the translation process.
Start from scratch to initialize settings for a reference translation. You will be presented with blank settings, and will need to enter the name of the translation, its books, etc.
Make use of existing settings for a reference translation. If you defined the translation in another project, then you can reuse it here, rather than entering the information all over again.
Remove the selected translation from the list above. This does not remove the settings file from the disk; it only removes it from this project.

Item.Tip: Typically the Ethnoloque Code, a short (e.g., 3-letter) abbreviation of the language name. One of its uses is in composing the filenames.
The Writing System for the translation, you define these under Team Settings.
The Writing System for advisor or consultant text (e.g., the back translation), you define these under Team Settings.
If Yes, OurWord starts up maximized. This may help newer users to have sufficient size on the screen for doing work.
If Yes, OurWord will automatically back up your fields to the folder specified below.
Choose a folder in which OurWord will automatically make backups of your files.
If a picture cannot be found, OurWord will search in this folder to attempt to locate it.
The color of the Drafting window background.
The color of the Back Translation window background.
The color of the Naturalness Check window background
The color of the Notes window background.
The color of the Other Translations window background.
Use this language for the User Interface.
Use this language for the User Interface if the preferred (primary) language is unavailable
Text in the windows can be larger (or smaller) by the chosen percentage.
If yes, the General Note will be visible when the Notes Pane is active; it will show up both in the Notes Pane and as icons in the text.
The color for the background of the General Note in the Notes Pane.
If yes, the Hint for Drafting Daughters Note will be visible when the Notes Pane is active; it will show up both in the Notes Pane and as icons in the text.
The color for the background of the Hint for Drafting Daughters Note in the Notes Pane.

Item.English: Show Hints from the Front Translation?
Item.Tip: If yes, any Hint For Daughter notes that were defined in the Front Translation will be visible.
If yes, the To Do Note will be visible when the Notes Pane is active; it will show up both in the Notes Pane and as icons in the text.
The color for the background of the To Do Note in the Notes Pane.
If yes, the Ask UNS Note will be visible when the Notes Pane is active; it will show up both in the Notes Pane and as icons in the text.
The color for the background of the Ask UNS Note in the Notes Pane.
If yes, the Reason Note will be visible when the Notes Pane is active; it will show up both in the Notes Pane and as icons in the text.
The color for the background of the Reason Note in the Notes Pane.
If yes, the Front Issues Note will be visible when the Notes Pane is active; it will show up both in the Notes Pane and as icons in the text.
The color for the background of the Front Issues Note in the Notes Pane.
If yes, the Definitions Note will be visible when the Notes Pane is active; it will show up both in the Notes Pane and as icons in the text.
The color for the background of the Definitions Note in the Notes Pane.
If yes, the Old Versions Note will be visible when the Notes Pane is active; it will show up both in the Notes Pane and as icons in the text.
The color for the background of the Old Versions Note in the Notes Pane.
If yes, the Back Translation Note will be visible when the Notes Pane is active; it will show up both in the Notes Pane and as icons in the text.
The color for the background of the Back Translation Note in the Notes Pane.
If yes, the Exegesis Note will be visible when the Notes Pane is active; it will show up both in the Notes Pane and as icons in the text.
The color for the background of the Exegesis Note in the Notes Pane.

Item.English: Please wait while OurWord examines this file...
This wizard will guide you through the process of importing an existing Scripture file into OurWord.
Please browse to the file that you wish to import:
Please wait while OurWord examines this file...
File '{0}' does not appear to be a Standard Format file. It does not begin with a backslash character.)
File '{0}' is not in a supported encoding. It should either be ASCII or UTF8.
Choose the file you wish to import
Note: Only those books which are currently possibilities are shown here. Thus for example, books that have already been imported are not in this list.
You can optionally enter a version for this stage, e.g., 'A', 'B', etc.
At what stage of translation is this book?
(Note: All of this information is optional; but highly recommended if the book being imported is still in the process of being translated.)
(OurWord will default to using the same folder that the Import file is in; but you can change it here if you wish.)
Please indicate which Folder you would this file to be stored under:
OurWord will store the book under this filename:
OurWord is now ready to import:
Click the Finish button to import this book into OurWord, or press the Previous button to make changes..
